page.title: 01Introduction to D Block
page.content: This block is predominantly rural and contains six sizeable farms.The only settlement is that of Alvechurch in the northern section.The main road is the A441 linking Alvechurch to Birmingham and Redditch,and the other three roads are C class.The centre of the block is cut by the Birmingham to Worcester canal,and by the Redditch to Birmingham railway.The undulating nature of the land adds to its general isolation.There is a marked absence of industry,and one twelfth of the area is covered by woodland mainly deciduous,and the remainder by farmland,and most of this is grassland used for pasture,and for cutting as grass,silage or hay.
